name: Container Gardening
description: Container gardening involves growing plants in containers instead of directly in the ground, making it ideal for balconies and small spaces.
step_by_step: Select containers with proper drainage holes.
Fill them with a mix of soil and compost.
Sow seeds or transplant seedlings.
Place containers in sunny areas (balcony, windowsill).
Water regularly and monitor for pests.

name: Sack Gardening
description: Sack gardening uses vertical sacks filled with soil to grow plants, maximizing vertical space on balconies or yards.
step_by_step: Fill sack with alternating layers of soil and compost.
Add stones in the center for drainage.
Cut small holes around the sack for planting.
Plant seedlings in the holes and at the top.
Water regularly from the top.

name: Barrel Gardening
description: This method uses old barrels to create vertical gardens with holes on the sides and plants growing outward.
step_by_step: Drill holes around the sides of the barrel.
Fill barrel with soil and compost.
Plant seedlings in side holes and top.
Water from the top and monitor growth.

name: Layer Gardening
description: Layer gardening involves arranging different plant beds or containers in layered rows to save space.
step_by_step: Set up frame to hold containers at different levels.
Fill each container with soil and compost.
Plant suitable crops in each container based on light needs.
Water regularly.

name: Bottle Gardening
description: This eco-friendly method involves reusing plastic bottles to grow small plants, often hanging vertically or on walls.
step_by_step: Cut a rectangular opening on the side of the bottle.
Make drainage holes at the bottom.
Fill with soil and compost mix.
Plant seeds or seedlings.
Hang using string and water lightly.

name: Vertical Gardening
description: Vertical gardening uses upright structures like walls or frames to grow plants upward, maximizing vertical space.
step_by_step: Set up your vertical structure against a wall or balcony.
Place containers or pockets on the frame.
Add soil and compost.
Plant appropriate crops.
Ensure good sunlight and water regularly.
